channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Three-fourths of homeowners may not have enough insurance to fully cover losses after a disaster, study says
item.description: "When consumers focus on premiums rather than coverage limits, insurers have a very natural incentive to cut prices by offering less insurance."

item.title: How to Survive January
item.description: Lotion! Heating pads! Sketchy space heaters!

item.title: Special counsel Jack Smith resigns after submitting Trump report on overturning 2020 results and classified documents
item.description: The Justice Department disclosed Smith's departure in a court filing Saturday, saying he had resigned one day earlier.

item.title: A French Cathedral Turned to Hams to Restore Its Organ
item.description: A dispute over a project to cure hams in a bell tower underscored the difficulties that churches in France face trying to pay for restorations.

item.title: A French Cathedral Turned to Hams to Restore Its Organ
item.description: A dispute over a project to cure hams in a bell tower underscored the difficulties that churches in France face trying to pay for restorations.

item.title: The Surprising Grief of Having Your Home Survive a Wildfire
item.description: For people whose homes are spared in a wildfire while their neighbors lose everything, the road ahead can be isolating, plagued by feelings of guilt a...

item.title: Lebanon’s Prime Minister Meets With Syrian Leader
item.description: The visit by Prime Minister Najib Mikati was the first official trip by the Lebanese leader to meet with the new government of Syria.

item.title: The Old World Is Breaking Down. A New One Is Breaking Through.
item.description: Four trends are converging to make life much scarier.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg slams Apple on innovation during Joe Rogan podcast — ‘They haven’t invented anything great in a while’
item.description: Meta’s CEO also called out the iPhone maker for its rules on third-party developers.

item.title: Ukraine Says It Captured 2 North Korean Soldiers Fighting for Russia
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky said the soldiers were captured in the western Kursk region, where Ukraine has been fighting to hold on to territory it s...

item.title: Synagogue Congregation Grieves in Borrowed Home After L.A. Fires
item.description: Across Los Angeles, congregants displaced by the blazes met for their first services in borrowed churches, synagogues and other temples.

item.title: Firefighters race to stop spreading wildfires before strong winds threaten UCLA, Getty Museum — ‘We need to be aggressive out there’
item.description: A fierce battle against the flames was underway in Mandeville Canyon, home to Arnold Schwarzenegger and other celebrities not far from the Pacific coa...

item.title: Sudan’s Military Recaptures Key City From Paramilitary Accused of Genocide
item.description: Celebrations erupted in military-controlled areas, stoking hopes the victory might be a turning point in Sudan’s ruinous civil war.

item.title: Bessent to sell hedge fund stake if confirmed to lead Treasury
item.description: The hedge fund manager disclosed assets worth at least $521 million in his personal financial disclosure.

item.title: Far From the Fires, the Deadly Risks of Smoke Are Intensifying
item.description: Researchers see a growing health danger from the vast plumes of pollution spawned by wildfires like the ones devastating Los Angeles.
